column4: can someone help me, or just say that is not possible to connect the mpman tk250 mp4 on linux!
plug it in, there will then be a connection
oh you want to copy things to it?
thats a bit more than a connection dude
when you last unplugged it, did you safely remove it or did you ust yank it out?
did you safetly remove it last time it was plugged in to windows?
when you unplugged it from windows, did you use the safe remove feature
have you checked the file system health in Windows too
can you answer my 2 questions please
when you unplug it, do you safetly remove it
have you check the file system health in windows
it is there for a REASON
if you don't unmount the device properly in Windows it wil be marked as dirty and Linux will have issues with it. You will also not physically damage the device
you as mistreating your device, then are surpricd you are getting issues?
plug the device into windows and check the device's health
then in the system tray, you will see an icon to eject the device safely, use this and I bet it works in Linux without issue
